subject: DEAR SIR,
body:
DEAR SIR,
 
FORWARDED BELOW WAS EMAIL FROM THE NATIONAL DRUG LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY DATED 19TH JUNE, 2018, PLEASE REFER. THE EMAIL IS SELF-EXPLANATORY AS IT ALSO CONTAINED THE FEE FOR OBTAINING THE CERTIFICATE. 
 
SINCE WE HAVE NOT HEARD FROM YOU FOR THE PAST FEW WEEKS NOW, HENCE THE PURPOSE OF THIS EMAIL TO LET US KNOW HOW FAR YOU HAVE GONE WITH THEM AND ALSO LET US KNOW IF YOU HAVE BEEN ABLE TO SETTLE THE REQUIRED FEE FOR SECURING THE NDLEA FUND CLEARANCE CERTIFICATE BUT IN CASE YOU ARE UNABLE TO PAY THE FEE, YOU SHOULD ALSO LET US KNOW SO THAT WE KNOW THE AREA WE CAN BE OF ANY ADDITIONAL HELP TO YOU.
 
AND AGAIN WHY IT NECESSARY FOR YOU TO WORK HARD TO SEE THAT THIS PAYMENT IS MADE SINCE FEDERAL MINISTRY OF FINANCE HAD ALREADY APPROVED THE PAYMENT IS THAT BY NEXT YEAR, NIGERIA SHALL BE GOING ON VOTING FOR A NEW GOVERNMENT AND NOBODY KNOWS WHAT IS GOING TO THE THE POLICY OF THE NEW GOVERNMENT AFTER THE ELECTION ON FOREIGN PAYMENT CURRENCY TRANSACTIONS. THIS IS JUST AN INFORMATION ANY WAY.
 
THANK YOU AND HAVE A GREAT DAY.
 
YOURS FAITHFULLY,
 
DR. SARAH ALADE (MRS)
DEPUTY GOVERNOR (CBN)

subject: Re:    DEAR SIR,
body:
Hello Dr. Sarah Alade,

Thank you for reaching out and providing this information. I appreciate your concern about the situation.

I'm curious, could you please elaborate more on the role of the National Drug Law Agency in this matter? Also, what exactly does the NDLEA Fund Clearance entail?

Regarding the fee, I would like to know more about how it is calculated and what it covers. Is there a specific deadline for this payment?

Lastly, you mentioned that Nigeria will be voting for a new government next year. How might this impact foreign payment currency policies? 

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Dana
